Posts.Content: Hope you sleep a bit tonight Yvonne. Horrible to toss and turn all night.  I tend to drop off reading a book but wide awake again a couple of hours later............. Take care S x
Posts.Title: Sick of not being able to sleep

Posts.Content: Hi Caroline I too have been recently diagnosed with breast cancer - last week and also cannot believe it.  It feels unreal. I don't feel ill at all and surgery is on 4 July.  But leading up to that is MRI scan and a nuclear medicine scan and pre-assessment - and like you am desperately worried that its already spread.  So scary.... Everyone is being very, very supportive (family and friends) but none of them know in the dark of the night the terror I go through worrying about the unknown. I just keeping counting the sleeps down until the next time I might be told the next bad news - like with the MRI scan results about how big the actual cancer is, and when the final biopsy results are in.  Then after the op and knowing if it has actually spread further................. How do you get through all this without going out of your mind.
Posts.Title: I feel Shellshocked.

Posts.Content: Hi I finished radiotherapy at the end of Oct and never thought about it but I did have a very dry throat - especially during the night although no cough.................. Hope you get a better nights sleep xxxx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy ,dry throat and cough

Posts.Content: Hi Andrea Welcome! I'm relatively new to all this - diagnosed in Mid June - still don't believe it can be true and I've had op and all the diagnosis info but still can't  believe it is happening to me! The only way is to take a day at a time and keep as busy as you can.  You get the tears and the middle of the night is the worst but take every offer of help there is. The worst part as Jane says is before the treatment begins after that there is always something to focus on. Good luck with everything. S xx
Posts.Title: New Person!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Andrea Welcome! I'm relatively new to all this - diagnosed in Mid June - still don't believe it can be true and I've had op and all the diagnosis info but still can't  believe it is happening to me! The only way is to take a day at a time and keep as busy as you can.  You get the tears and the middle of the night is the worst but take every offer of help there is. The worst part as Jane says is before the treatment begins after that there is always something to focus on. Good luck with everything. S xx
Posts.Title: New Person!!!

Posts.Content: Hi I had WLE and SNB on a Friday and was back at work full time on the Wed after.  That was 4 July for Op and I have been back at work full time since then.  I too work in an office on a computer all day and had absolutely no problems. Waiting for radiotherapy though and not sure how I will feel during/after that. good luck with everything:-)
Posts.Title: Off work

Posts.Content: Hi Is it normal to have lumps appearing under a lumpectomy scar. I had my op in July and finished radiotherapy at the end of October this year. No chemo. I am not sure if this lump has always been there since I had the op or if it has appeared recently....... I didn't have a lump originally - I had invasive lobular cancer and was diagnosed following a mammogram. The lump is at one end of the scar. I will ring my BCN in the morning but wondered if lumps appeared as a result of the operation............... or not usually. Many thanks Sandi
Posts.Title: Lump under lumpectomy scar query

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying - this has put my mind at rest somewhat. I have called my BCN and she has told me to monitor for a month and get back to her if I still have concerns. So keeping my fingers crossed that it is nothing Many thanks Sandi xx
Posts.Title: Lump under lumpectomy scar query

Posts.Content: Hi I had to request my pathology report after reading that other people had theirs on this site. My BC nurse told me she would have to ask if I could have it.  It was then handed to me at my first meeting with the radiotherapy Consultant who just handed it to me as he left our meeting. It wasn't discussed with me and I spent a very busy (and quite worrying) evening googling every phrase in the Report. I still am unsure on some of the phrases in it but feel it would have been better to have been discussed fully in a meeting and explained clearly to me. Hope you get all the info you want and its fully explained to you. Take care...Sandi x
Posts.Title: How long after surgery do you find out stage/ grade?

Posts.Content: Getting a bit worried now about Rads as I should be stating mine in the next few weeks.  Don't think I was as worried about the op as I am about this........................
Posts.Title: rads and pain!!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Rosalyn - think its always the fear of the unknown................... x
Posts.Title: rads and pain!!!
